thread.title: New York Fed Director Helping to Oversee Leadership Search Steps Down

author: Michael S. Derby
title: New York Fed Director Helping to Oversee Leadership Search Steps Down

organizations.name: federal reserve bank of new york

text:
One of the people overseeing the search for a new Federal Reserve Bank of New York president resigned from the bank’s board of directors Saturday, a day after officials said they had narrowed their list of candidates for the bank’s top job.

David Cote, the executive chairman of Honeywell International Inc., had served as a Class B director representing the public and not financial firms since 2014. Mr. Cote was one of four New York Fed board members managing the search for a successor to President William Dudley, who late...
